page.title: 14The W.I. in Barnby Dun 1985
page.content: The W.I. is a happy band, Of village ladies here, Who with many others through the land To their hearts hold the country dear. We meet once a month,sun or rain, In the Parish Hall at 7.15. When a speaker will entertain And talk of things they have seen. We have learned how bees make honey, And seen gastronomic delights. Of how to invest all our money, And all about citizen's rights. We fight for our village's welfare, We sometimes don't like what's planned We write letters to planners who don't Care what becomes of our village land. We make teas at fetes to raise money For other less fortunate folk. The W.I. is all about living, Women sharing together good things. Of a community caring and giving And friendship and trust that brings.
